intro: Nevrilis, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue-gray foliage and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Nevrilis is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Its foliage can be slightly fuzzy, giving it a distinctive texture and appearance.
